as long as there is a machine which accpets ssh connection on the same network as the game machine (perhaps the game machine itself) then a tunnel works -- the remote endpoint just needs to be able to make connections to the port on which the game server listens

taking out the VPN tunnel from the equation for a moment,  if you were on the the VPN server/proxy in person, could you connect to the game machine ?

then the vpn client [your machine] should be able to connect to the [game machine] directly .. as by definition, the vpn client _should_ hold an IP address in the same network/subnet as that of the [game machine]
